glsa.title: acroread: UUDecode filename buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: acroread contains two errors in the handling of UUEncoded filenames that may lead to execution of arbitrary code or programs.

background.p: acroread is Adobe's Acrobat PDF reader for Linux.

description.p: acroread contains two errors in the handling of UUEncoded filenames. First, it fails to check the length of a filename before copying it into a fixed size buffer and, secondly, it fails to check for the backtick shell metacharacter in the filename before executing a command with a shell.

impact.p: By enticing a user to open a PDF with a specially crafted filename, an attacker could execute arbitrary code or programs with the permissions of the user running acroread.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are encouraged to upgrade to the latest available version of acroread.
